key_16.name: Grateful Dead
key_16.set1:
Disc one
The Times When I Paint My Masterpiece Man Of Peace I'll Be Your Baby Tonight Ballad Of Ira Hayes (P.LaFarge) I Want You Ballad Of A Thin Man Stuck Inside Of Mobile Dead Man Dead Man Queen Jane Approximately Boy In The Bubble (P. Simon) The French Girl (Tyson / Fricker) In The Summertime Man Of Peace Union Sundown
Disc two
It's All Over Now Baby Blue Joey If Not For You Slow Train Tomorrow Is A Long Time Ballad Of Frankie Lee And Judas Priest John Brown I'll Be Your Baby Tonight Don't Keep Me Waiting Too Long Stealin' (Trad./ Memphis Jug Band arr.) I Want You Oh Boy (West/Tilghman/Petty) Tangled Up In Blue
Disc three
Walking Down The Line Simple Twist Of Fate Gotta Serve Somebody Gonna Change My Way Of Thinking Maggie's Farm Chimes Of Freedom All I Really Want To Do John Brown Heart Of Mine Rollin' In My Sweet Baby's Arms (Trad.) John Hardy (Alvin Carter) Heart Of Mine Wicked Messenger Watching The River Flow
key_16.comment: Incorrect date. This is the Grateful Dead rehearsals with Bob Dylan. Called "French Girl"

key_32.name: Grateful Dead
key_32.set1: Disc 1 1. The Times They Are A-Changin' 2. When I Paint My Masterpiece 3. Man O' Peace 4. I'll Be Your Baby Tonight 5. Ira Hayes 6. I Want You 7. Ballad Of A Thin Man 8. Stuck Inside Of Mobile With The Memphis Blues Again 9. Walkin' Down The Line 10. Serve Somebody 11. Change My Way Of Thinkin' 12. Maggie's Farm
key_32.set2: Disc 2 1. All I Really Want To Do 2. John Brown Goes To War 3. Heart Of Mine 4. Rolling In My Sweet Baby's Arms 5. Ballad of Frankie Lee and Judas Priest 6. John Brown 7. Don't Keep Me Waiting 8. Stealin' 9. Oh Boy! 10. Tangled Up In Blue 11. Boy In The Bubble

key_33.name: Grateful Dead
key_33.comment: Local coverage of the two day event May 9th and 10th 1987 at Laguna Seca Racetrack in Monterey, CA. Interviews with Peter Barsotti, Bill Graham, Deadheads, Vendors and others. Some humor thrown in as well. This is a time capsule of a fantastic weekend.

key_45.name: Grateful Dead
key_45.set1:
Disc 1 - Prehearsals ---------- 1.) The French Girl/Blues Stay Away From Me 2.) Conversation 3.) John Hardy [John Hardy Was A Desperate Man] 4.) Conversation 5.) Instrumental Jam 6.) I'm So Lonesome I Could Cry/Blues Stay Away From Me
Disc 2 - Rehearsals ---------- 1.) The Times They Are A-Changin' 2.) When I Paint My Masterpiece 3.) Man Of Peace 4.) I'll Be Your Baby Tonight 5.) The Ballad Of Ira Hayes 6.) I Want You 7.) Ballad Of A Thin Man 8.) Stuck Inside Of Mobile With The Memphis Blues Again 9.) Dead Man, Dead Man 10.) Queen Jane Approximately 11.) The French Girl 12.) In The Summertime 13.) Man Of Peace 14.) Union Sundown 15.) It?s All Over Now, Baby Blue 16.) Joey
Disc 3 - Rehearsals ---------- 1.) If Not For You 2.) If Not For You 3.) Slow Train 4.) Tomorrow Is A Long Time 5.) Walkin' Down The Line 6.) Gotta Serve Somebody 7.) Gonna Change My Way Of Thinking 8.) Maggie's Farm 9.) Chimes of Freedom 10.) All I Really Want To Do 11.) John Brown 12.) Heart Of Mine 13.) Rolling In My Sweet Baby's Arms 14.) John Hardy [John Hardy Was A Desperate Man] 15.) The Ballad Of Frankie Lee And Judas Priest 16.) John Brown 17.) I'll Be Your Baby Tonight
Disc 4 - Rehearsals ---------- 1.) Don?t Keep Me Waiting Too Long [Go Ahead, Baby] 2.) Stealin? 3.) I Want You 4.) Oh Boy 5.) Tangled Up In Blue 6.) Simple Twist Of Fate 7.) The Boy In The Bubble 8.) Heart Of Mine 9.) Pledging My Time 10.) Senor (Tales Of Yankee Power) 11.) The Wicked Messenger 12.) Watching The River Flow
Disc 5 - Rehearsals ---------- 1.) Under Your Spell 2.) I'm So Lonesome I Could Cry 3.) Blues Stay Away From Me 4.) If Not For You 5.) The Ballad Of Frankie Lee And Judas Priest 6.) Senor (Tales Of Yankee Power) 7.) I'll Be Your Baby Tonight 8.) I'm Free 9.) They Killed Him 10.) Pledging My Time 11.) Oh Boy
Disc 6 - The Grateful Dead Hour #705, broadcast week of 25 Mar 2002 ---------- 1.) Introduction by David Gans 2.) Gans interviewed by Gary Lambert 3.) All Along The Watchtower 4.) More Gans interview 5.) Stealin' 6.) Gans 7.) Oh Boy 8.) John Brown 9.) Folsom Prison Blues 10.) Gotta Serve Somebody 11.) Hideaway/C C Rider 12.) Gans conclusion

key_53.name: Grateful Dead
key_53.set1: 1. Evening Magazine (KPIX) 7-14-87 This short feature was spawned by the whirlwind of publicity the Grateful Dead received in the summer of 1987. With the new album \"In The Dark\", the surprising hit song \"Touch of Grey\" and the MTV video of that song, The Boys were on a very big roll. As if these things weren\'t enough, they did huge stadium concerts with Bob Dylan. Nice interviews, some historic footage, and plenty of live concert clips (Frost Amp. 1985 & 1987, and very cool Greek Theatre 1981) will hold any Deadhead\'s attention. 2. 7-24-87 Dead/Dylan news report (KRON) Reporter: Don Knapp 3. 7-24-87 Dead Dylan news reports (KGO) Reporter: Aaron Edwards 4. 7-24-87 Dead/Dylan news report (KPIX) Reporter: Stan Wilson

key_58.name: Grateful Dead
key_58.comment:
A day-long salute to the Grateful Dead on MTV, which was playing Touch of Grey heavily in it's rotation at the time. Many believe this was the beggining of the end for the Grateful Dead.
From "Skeleton Key - A Dictionary For Deadheads" - The success of "A Touch of Grey" is often cited for the influx of younger Heads onto the scene (though Steve Marcus believes it was MTV's "Day of the Dead").
"They kept cutting into the parking lot scene at Giants Stadium, saying, "Cool, dude, what a party!" And a whole shitload of folks came in to party. They didn't even know who the Dead were. You'd see a lot of people in leather with metal studs and pointed hair,'cause it was "Grateful Dead" - sounds like a metal band! They didn't have a clue. And a lot of the younger ones just didn't have Deadhead etiquette. When I started working for the Dead in 1983, the median age group was twenty-seven years old. By late 1987, it was down to about eighteen. That's a hell of a jump. But it's their band too." - Steve Marcus
Here then, is MTV's "Day of the Dead". All blatantly official segments have been removed.
Disc 1: MTV Day Of The Dead (22:41)
Hosts: Julie Brown, China Kantner, Kevin Seal Reporters: Carolyne Heldman, Rich Shydner With a cast of thousands, including: Jerry Garcia Mickey Hart The Deadheads
Disc 2: Dead On - The Grateful Dead Alive In The 80's (26:06)
Special MTV documentary with appearances by: Jerry Garcia, Bob Weir, Bill Kreutzmann, Mickey Hart, Dan Healy, Les Kippel, Toni Brown, Jacaeber Kastor, Bill Graham, Peter Martin, Stanley Mouse, Rick Griffin,

key_74.name: Grateful Dead
key_74.comment:
Jerry Garcia & Bob Weir "So Far" Press Conference NYC, NY 9-14-87 Graceful Duck Archive
Cable > SuperBeta Hi-Fi > Edit SuperBeta Hi-Fi > Playback Sony EDV-9500 > Standalone Panasonic DMR-E50 (XP)> TMPGEnc DVD Author 3 No Artwork Chapters: 1 NTSC / Stereo TRT: 29:27 Audio codec: AC3 Audio bitrate: 256 kb/s Video codec: MPEG2 Video bitrate: 9221 kb/s Picture resolution: 704x480
Here is the most complete version I have come across of the "So Far" press conterence held on September 14th, 1987 in New York City. Grateful Dead publicist Dennis McNally introduces the panel - Jerry Garcia, Bob Weir, Len Dell'Amico, and Clive Davis. This press conference centers on the video project "So Far", but strays into other interesting topics. At one point, when Jerry Garcia is asked "How did things go with your sessions with Robert Hunter?", the tape suddenly fast forwards and goes to black. When the video resumes, Dennis McNally reminds the press that "So Far is the reason we came here today".
I found two very short clips from this event at YouTube, which are of much better quality than this, but with the upcoming release of "So Far" for the first time on DVD (April 2012),I felt that this was a timely upload. You will find this video both informative, and entertaining.

key_98.name: Grateful Dead
key_98.comment:
Liner Notes: An in-depth interview with the GRATEFUL DEAD conducted by BRENT MYDLAND, featuring JERRY GARCIA, BOB WEIR, PHIL LESH, and MICKEY HART.
Arista sent me this promo album along with the ?Touch of Grey? single, the ?My Brother Esau? cassette, and an ?In The Dark? bumper sticker when I worked at a radio station. The album cover mimicked ?In The Dark? but it was black and white. Side one was un-racked for radio play, which I chose to digitize, as the running time is just over twenty minutes and is easily listened to in one sitting. Arista must have been in a hurry, because Dick Latvala?s name was misspelled as Latuala.

key_101.name: Grateful Dead
key_101.comment: -This movie presents a wonderful documentary of the band's backstage antics, and includes sound checks, show snippets, and lots of backstage bantering. -This 2 disc movie is comprised of 2 vcd-compliant mpeg-1 files. -There was no text file or information included with the original mpegs. -I have deduced that this movie contains footage from the following tours:Summer 1987, Fall 1987, Spring 1988, Summer 1988, Fall 1988 -No director/producer credits provided, by I suspect Justin Kreutzman is the culprit.
